result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Porcaro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Election Fraud-Illegal Voting, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 12.13(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

BY THE COURT:***

Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on May 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Same conditions.
Defendant Daniel R Porcaro in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Court will stay issuance of warrant for one week

Attorney Jared Redfield in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:18 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant is not present.

Atty Redfield addresses the Court, tried contacting Defendant but has not gotten any response.

Court reviews the file.

Defendant was in Court in Feb for an arraignment. That would have been the last time Atty Redfield had contact.

Atty Redfield has represented Defendant in the past, does forget about court dates and doesn't keep track of time.
Atty Redfield requests one week to get a hold of Defendant. 

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, requests bench warrant, $500 cash alternative.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a bench warrant, $500 cash alternative, but stay issuance of warrant for a week to permit time for Atty Redfield arrange for a voluntary appearance.

Atty Redfield addresses the Court, states that Defendant likes the plea offer.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-21-2016 11:00 am

Defendant Daniel R Porcaro in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:53 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for an arraignment at this time.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, information has been filed. Atty Redfield has received a copy of the information and has previously waived preliminary hearing.

There was not a hearing on the waiver, the waiver was simply filed.

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing, was filed December 2015.
Defendant remembers signing the form.
Defendant intends to waive the preliminary hearing.
Court questions Defendant on his waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court informs Defendant of rights that he will be giving up.

Court questions Atty Redfield regarding waiver.

Court finds Defendant waives his hearing freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understanding.
Court binds Defendant over for trial.

Atty Redfield received a copy of the information, waives reading.

Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.

Atty Knaapen states bond was previously set, requests bond to be continued.
Atty Redfield concurs.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

Case will be discussed this morning and then the State will file a report with the Judicial Assistant.
